cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi SW of Pensacola, Florida (or 75 mi S of Mobile, Alabama)
cyclone.trajectory: Creeping north-northeast and then northeast, expected to cross the north-central Gulf Coast and move inland across southeastern Alabama and Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Alabama–Florida Panhandle coastline (Mobile Bay–Pensacola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None (all official watches/warnings are confined to the north-central Gulf Coast, well west of the Florida Peninsula)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from east of Bay St. Louis, MS, to Navarre, FL; Tropical-Storm Warning from Grand Isle, LA, to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, western Florida Panhandle) and eventually inland across AL, GA, and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional breezy showers; tropical-storm-force winds are very unlikely at PortMiami
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Minor, scattered showers possible from distant outer moisture
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated rip-current risk along Florida east coast beaches, otherwise none
